description.narrative: CNVP (Connecting Natural Values and People Foundation) har ansökt om projektstöd för local ekonomisk utveckling, inceptionfas, på landsbygden i Albanien. Inceptionfasen beräknas pågå ett år , fro m april 2019 to mars 2020. Insatsen syftar till bättre inkomstmöjligheter för familjer på landsbygden i landets bergsområden genom att: i) Utveckla marknaden för medicinska och aromatiska växter och andra skogsprodukter (MAP), ii) stöd till producentgrupper och iii) stärkt institutionell miljö för marknadsanalys/-föring och produktion av MAPs. CNVP ska under inceptionfasen fokusera en pilotverksamhet för utveckling av fyra värdemarknadskedjor (Value-market-chains) i fyra regioner i Albanien. Insatsens budget är 5.3 miljoner SEK. Sidas bidrag är 5 miljoner och resterande 300.000 SEK är CNVPs egenbidrag.

Connecting Natural Values and People Foundation (CNVP) has submitted to the Embassy a proposal on Local Economic Development Programme - Inception Phase to be implemented in Rural Albania. The Inception phase of the project will last one year, from March 2019 - 28 February 2019. The intervention aims to support income opportunities for the households in rural mountainous Albania by: i) Developing markets for Medical Aromatic Plants (MAP) and other forest produce, ii) well-functioning producers groups, and iii) Improving enabling environment for the marketing and management/production of MAPs and other forest produce. During the Inception Phase will be looked into piloting the market system in four value chains of MAPs in four regions in Albania.
The budget for this intervention is 5,3 million SEK. Sida financing is assessed to 5 million SEK and the difference is the CNVP own funds.

During Inception Phase, the project will work with municipalities to promote the planting of abandoned/non-productive land with MAPs to create successful pilot projects, which can be further replicated in other areas, during the next years. The goal of the project is: To enhance economic growth of rural mountainous Albania through the development of the marketing system for Medical Aromatic Plants (MAPs) and other forest produce. The project objective is: To improve the income opportunities of households by supporting marketing, production and sustainable management of MAPs and other forest produce in 4 targeted Regions. The proposed project addresses problems and opportunities in three main areas which correspond to the three outcomes of the project. Outcome 1: Developed markets for MAPs and other forest produce of better quality and safety Outcome 2: Well-functioning producer groups Outcome 3: Improved enabling environment for the marketing and anagement / production of MAPs and other forest produce The project will be implemented by a team of multi-disciplinary advisers working in Korca, Shkodra and Elbasan/Tirana who are able to build rapport with local stakeholders in the municipalities, as well as enhance effective and efficient project implementation.

tag.narrative: 1.2 - By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions.
1.2 - Till 2030 minst halvera den andel män, kvinnor och barn i alla åldrar som lever i någon form av fattigdom enligt nationella definitioner.
8.2 - Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors.
8.2 - Uppnå högre ekonomisk produktivitet genom diversifiering, teknisk uppgradering och innovation, bland annat genom att fokusera på sektorer med högt förädlingsvärde och hög arbetsintensitet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: About 300 direct and 200 indirect beneficiearies have been reached during the first phase of the LED. Some of the key results are described as following: - A detailed analysis on the market system in the MAPs and the needed interventions. - Ten value chains of MAPs (Sage, Thymus, Lavender, Laurel, Cian, Calendula, Sunflower, Mallow, Immortelle, LAvender Vera) have been selected in cooperation with the private sector and designed specific intervetions. - Partnership/cost share agreements signed with four MAPs companies in targeted regions: LNL HERBS/ Shkoder, MEIA/Tirana, Bio Holta/Gramsh, Wita Herbs/Korca. - 72 contract farming facilitated between selected MAPs companies and households, 22 are women. - A strategy on business driven extension services is prepared and started implemented. - About 80 housholds trained on organic cultivation, 300 households received extension services. - Introduced mechanisation services like drying facilities, stone crushing. - Introduced new MAP varieties certified seedlings and tested for organic cultivation. - A guideline for the municipalities in procedures for renting abandoned lands is prepared. - A baseline study conducted together with setting the pillars for further assessment and evaluation on the project impact to the households involved in MAPs activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
